name: Kelvin O. Omereshone
description: Lead maintainer of Sails , JavaScript engineer and Developer Advocate at Treblle. Helping developers build business on JavaScript. Teaching fullstack JavaScript, API monitoring and observability.

name: Indie Hackers
description: Connect with developers who are sharing the strategies and revenue numbers behind their companies and side projects.

description: A guide to help you get started with indie hacking by @rameerez.

name: Tim Bennetto
description: Bootstrapped indie hacker. Building pally.com and threadcreator.com

name: Building Businesses on JavaScript
description: Learn how to build businesses with JavaScript and indie hacking. Real stories of real people building real businesses on JavaScript.

name: Wilson Wilson
description: Building senja - Wake up to an inbox full of new testimonial alerts. Share them everywhere in seconds.

name: Tally Forms
description: The simplest way to create beautiful forms & surveys, for free. Made by @mariemartens & @filipminev

description: Learn to build profitable startups the indie way by Pieter Levels

name: Tony Dinh's Newsletter
description: Monthly updates about my indie hacking journey, what I have built and learned.

name: Notion
description: Notion is a versatile productivity tool that combines note-taking, task management, and collaboration in one platform. With its customizable interface and extensive range of features, it empowers users to stay organized, work efficiently, and collaborate seamlessly.

name: Hacker News
description: Hacker News is a social news website focusing on computer science and entrepreneurship. It is run by the investment fund and startup incubator Y Combinator. In general, content that can be submitted is defined as "anything that gratifies one's intellectual curiosity."

name: Arvid Kahl
description: Arvid Kahl is a software engineer, entrepreneur, and writer.

name: The $100 Startup
description: Bestselling book by Chris Guillebeau that offers guidance and inspiration for aspiring entrepreneurs looking to start their own businesses with minimal financial resources.

name: Rob Wailling
description: Rob Walling is a serial entrepreneur, author, podcaster, and angel investor.

name: Tyler Tringas
description: Tyler Tringas is an entrepreneur and venture capitalist known for his work in the startup ecosystem, particularly in the field of subscription-based businesses.

name: SaaS Roundup
description: Curated resource that delivers regular updates and insights on the latest trends, news, and strategies in the Software as a Service (SaaS) industry to help professionals stay informed and make informed business decisions.

name: MicroConf
description: MicroConf is a community of SaaS founders that brings together bootstrapped and independently-funded B2B SaaS companies who are not looking to chase ‚Äúunicorn status'' or venture capital.

name: The Lean Startup
description: Book by Eric Ries that introduces a methodology for developing businesses and products through iterative experimentation, validated learning, and continuous adaptation to efficiently navigate the uncertainties of the startup world.

name: Tweet Hunter
description: Get sales, growth and new networks. Faster than what you're currently trying.

name: Render
description: The fastest way to host all your code. Render is a unified cloud to build and run all your apps

name: Paddle
description: Increase your revenue, reduce costs and cut down risk automatically. Our products simplify and automate your billing operations so you can focus on growth.

name: Feather
description: Write your content on Notion and automatically publish it to your SEO-friendly blog ‚Äì No coding or design skills required.

name: R/indiehackers
description: An indie hacker community on reddit.

name: Simple.ink
description: Build a website with Notion. Everything is optimized for 0-headache, so you can focus on creating and building.

name: Ch Daniel
description: Starting now: http://SaaSPad.co (SEO as a service for SaaS companies)‚ö°Ô∏è http://UseSignHouse.com‚ö°Ô∏è Running http://Reddit.com/r/SaaS‚ö°Ô∏è 11M+ all-time users‚ö°Ô∏è http://Simple.ink (Acquired)

name: Nico
description: Dropped school, then managed +$1M in ads, then got fired. Then learned to code in 2 months, made 17 apps in 10 months and sold one for $65,000.

name: Indie Bites
description: Short, bite-sized conversations (15 mins) with indie hackers that have started small, profitable and bootstrapped businesses. You'll learn how they come up with ideas, what they do to validate, find those first customers and make a sustainable income. Episodes every Tuesday.

name: Hoodmaps by Pieter Levels
description: Building a startup in public: from first line of code to frontpage of Reddit

name: B.I.P by Kevon Cheung
description: Building in Public Definitive Guide 2023. The secrets to building successful products with a raving audience

name: B.I.P Cheatsheet by CH Daniel
description: The Cheatsheet initially represented my notes, but as I shared it with others, it got some positive feedback: it was not only wanted, but also needed. I made a few extra steps (which I wouldn't have done if it was just a private note) and here we are.

name: Pieter Levels
description: üë¶ php+jquery4life üì∏ http://PhotoAI.com $79K MRR üñº http://InteriorAI.com $52K MRR üõ∞ http://RemoteOK.com $47K/m üåç http://NomadList.com $32K/m üè° http://Rebase.co $14K/m üí¨ http://t.me/levelsio $4K/m

name: Paul Mit
description: 3—Ö Saas Founder üåø @aaplyHQ + @flowmapp + foundbase ‚ú®$600,000 ARR ‚Üí bootstrap, üôÖ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è no VC, product-led growth, micro-teams, $0 marketing.

name: Taylor Otwell
description: Taylor Otwell is a software developer and the creator of the PHP web application framework called Laravel. He is known for his contributions to the PHP community and for developing tools and resources to simplify web application development.

name: Startups for the rest of us
description: Whether you‚Äôre preparing to launch or you‚Äôve hit $10M ARR, learn from successful founders who have been in your shoes.

name: Getting to Ramen
description: Listen in as I navigate the slow SaaS ramp of death while asking for help along the way from people like Justin Jackson, Matt Wensing, and others who have gone before me.

name: The Bootstrapped Founder Podcast
description: The Bootstrapped Founder Podcast is a weekly show about starting and bootstrapping businesses, how to build an audience, and how to build in public.

name: This Indie Life
description: This Indie Life follows the journey of two indie hackers, James McKinven and Dagobert Renouf, as we navigate the good, the bad and the ugly, attempting to turn our indie hacker dreams into reality.

name: The Art of Product
description: The Art of Product is a podcast chronicling the journeys of two entrepreneurs building software companies. Hosted by Ben Orenstein and Derrick Reimer.

name: Bootstrapped Web
description: Brian Casel (@casjam) and Jordan Gal (@jordangal) share their raw and real behind-the-scenes of their entrepreneur journeys. From bootstrapping software startups to raising money to selling and exiting businesses, to growing teams and the emotional rollercoaster that is startup life.

name: Startup to something
description: A weekly podcast by two indie hackers, Marc and Matt. Follow along as they share their ups and downs of building their bootstrapped online businesses.

name: The Minimalist Entrepreneur
description: A revolutionary roadmap for building startups that go the distance. Now more than ever, you don‚Äôt need a fancy office, Ivy League degree, or millions of dollars in venture capital to launch a business that matters for the communities you care most about. Software, the internet, and remote work have made it possible for entrepreneurs to start for free, make a customer of anyone, and grow a profitable, sustainable company from anywhere.

name: Start Small, Stay Small: A Developer's Guide to Launching a Startup
description: Start Small, Stay Small is a step-by-step guide to launching a self-funded startup. If you're a desktop, mobile or web developer, this book is your blueprint to getting your startup off the ground with no outside investment.This book intentionally avoids topics restricted to venture-backed startups such as: honing your investment pitch, securing funding, and figuring out how to use the piles of cash investors keep placing in your lap.

name: From Single to Scale: How a Single Person, Small Business, or an Entrepreneur Can Grow Their Business to Profit
description: Scale your single-person business to profitability. Increase your audience, create multiple products, and generate more profit. This book takes you through the entire process of building a scalable business from the seemingly impossible place of being just one person.

name: Start From Zero: Build Your Own Business. Experience True Freedom
description: Learn How To Start A Business From Nothing. This book is full of real world stories from an entrepreneur who had over 10 business failures, started from nothing, and finally found the successful patterns to become a Millionaire before the age of 30.

name: Software Social
description: Software Social is a weekly 30 minute conversation between two founders: one just starting out, and one established. We‚ÄîColleen and Michele‚Äîhope you'll join our conversation about what's going on in our businesses. Nominated for Best Podcast, Best Episode, and Best Hosts in the 2020 SaaS Podcast Awards.

name: My First Million
description: Every week we dive deep into different business opportunities and explain how to pounce on them. Basically...we spoon-feed you interesting businesses you can start tomorrow. And hey, maybe it'll help you get your first million users, revenue, profit, employees (that'd be wild), or whatever it is you want a million of.

name: Build your SAAS
description: What does it take to build a Software as a Service business in 2023? Follow Jon and Justin in their journey of building, launching, and growing Transistor.fm. Jon Buda lives in Chicago. He's been involved in the podcasting world since 2013 and has been building software since 2002. Justin Jackson lives in British Columbia. He's been doing Product Management with SaaS companies since 2008 and podcasting since 2012.

name: Plausible Analytics
description: Hi! We are Uku and Marko. We're building a lightweight, non-intrusive alternative to Google Analytics. You can read about our journey and what we've learnt along the way on this blog.

name: Jakob Greenfeld
description: Hi, I'm Jakob! Co-founder of Sales.co. Author of the Business Brainstorms newsletter. Helping podcast and newsletter operaters secure sponsorships with Sponsor Hawk. Creator of Scraping the Web for Fun and Profit.

name: Awesome Indie
description: Awesome Indie is a small directory for makers and micro-startup founders to share their projects and get feedback from the community. We allow submissions of products made by solo-makers or startups bootstrapped by small teams are allowed. Also, the product should have a dedicated website.

name: Naz Avo
description: It's a blog of a recently retired 32-year-old software developer doing indie hacking with all the newly found free time. The blog's main theme is tech, nomadic lifestyle, and financial independence. Served with a pinch of Eastern European humor.
